review: After reading these reviews I've realized that unfortunately most reviewers don't understand how to properly use these devices.  Most people are pleased with the concept that now you can slice two bananas instead of just one.  However, that's not the situation at all.  In reality, one is a "right curve" banana slicer and the other is a "left curve" banana slicer.I'm sure the confusion comes from the photo, in which they show the left curve slicer facing the wrong direction.  However if one closely reads the 57-page instruction manual, it makes it very clear that one of the set is for slicing bananas that curve to the left.In addition there is another unadvertised-yet-useful function.  If you happen to have a banana that has been removed from the bunch and is now turned upside-down... this device easily flips over so that you can slice upside-down bananas as well.  This makes it well worth the value!The price here on Amazon is amazing as well.  I have seen this exact same item sell for $19.95 (plus shipping and handling of only $49.95) on late night TV shows.  I even found one listing here on Amazon where it was selling for $835.99!  So this is an excellent bargain.Do be aware that while it's not available on Amazon, the home website for this merchant also offers a set of these in green (for those bananas that aren't quiet yet ripe) as well as brown-spotted for pre-slicing over-ripe bananas just prior to mashing them to a pulp with the Hutzler 572 BananaMasher.Be sure to check out  the Hutzler 570 Banana Peeler as well.  It really saves time on those stubborn stems.
